column5: So I pulled all the tomatoes from the back 40 and now have many green ones...anyone here tried frying them or any other good things to do with them...I'm all ears...  Bob
Chow Chow  As for frying,butter in a pan,coat the slices with egg and flour, fry crispie. YUMMMY.
egg with a little cream, salt, pepper and garlic powder... stir well.  cover in flour and fry in butter....

O Bob one of the worst dinners I had as a kid was fried green tomatoes. I sat at the dinner table from 6:30 till 9:30 and went to bed. To this day I can't even smell them with out getting green.   Art
What ya talking about Art. Dems good eats with fried eggs and back bacon.Dont forget the nice golden baked biscuits and a side of beans
swap out the flour for Italian seasoned bread crumbs and a sprinkle of parm cheese
Now stop that.I can smell the ribs outside and dont want to spoil my hunger.You can also try Panko as a coating.Nice an crispy.
THANKS Gentlemen...and I use that term very loosely...LOL...  Tomorrow is Fried Green Tomatoes using a couple different recipes listed here...
Pickled green tomatoes are also right tasty. Just prepare a standard pickle brine. Instead of dill add a hot pepper or season with oregano
Knew I was missing something with me dinner. Oh well,have them Monday.
We slice them and fry them in butter with a little pepper and salt. Awesome!! One of my favorite summer treats!
BOb, toss the green tomatos in a paper bag, with a ripe apple. Close the bag and leave it on the counter for a couple of days... you now have ripe tomatos. HH
Thier not as good though Joe when you want green fried tomatoes.
Yah, but why have them green, when you can have 'em red!? HH
I do the same except I fry onions with the tomatoes and when done I Scramble a few eggs and mix in. Stand back, man a work, sparks coming off the fork
Thanks, now I know how to use up some of the green toamatoes from the garden, and I was just thinking about fried green tomatoes the other day...you been reading my mail B,Bob?
